direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods remove elements from the DOM but with different effects. 'remove' removes the elements entirely, while 'empty' removes the child nodes.
Both methods modify the DOM structure by removing elements. 'remove' removes the elements themselves, while 'unwrap' removes the elements but keeps their children.
Both methods perform removal operations, but 'removeAttr' removes attributes from elements, while 'remove' removes the elements themselves.
Both methods modify elements by removing something. 'removeClass' removes a class from elements, while 'remove' removes the elements from the DOM.
Both methods clear elements from a list. 'clear' removes all elements from the list and the DOM, while 'remove' removes the elements from the DOM but retains them in the list.
